intro: Adyseton edentulum, commonly known as the toothless adyseton, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to habitat loss, Adyseton edentulum is considered endangered and is protected in several states.
